text: Two weeks after the final immunization, randomized mice (n = 10/group) were transferred to a biological safety level 2 facility, where they were sedated (mixture of tiletamine and xylazine; 50 and 5 mg/kg of body weight, respectively) and challenged intranasally with ma-pH1N1 at 20-times the 50% lethal dose (20LD 50 ) and monitored for 14 consecutive days. Four days after infection, subset of mice (n = 2/group) were sacrificed and their lungs were collected (for analysis of viral shedding) and also stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). These experiments were performed by following designed experiment timelines (S1 Fig) .
